info.name: Destiny API Quick Start Guide

request.description:
Performs a user login request. If successful an HTTP code `200 OK` will be returned together with a new authorization token. Look at the `Authorization` header in the response, it will contain something like `bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1...`. 

> **Important:** This token must be cached by you and supplied with each subsequent requests to the API through the `Authorization` HTTP header.

> **Important:** The token is refreshed every few minutes by the API server. When any request is made by you and you receive the `Authorization` header, update your cache with the new token and then send the new token with each subsequent request. The old token does not immediately expire and is valid for 7 days.

response.name: 200 OK
425 User Not Found
401 Unauthorized

request.description:
This request returns details for all the units that are available to you in a paginated format.

> **Important:** The unit details returned with this request does not include GPS tracking or other sensor data.

response.name: 200 OK
response.body:
{
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "partner_id": 1,
            "partner": {
                "id": 1,
                "name": "Demo Partner"
            },
            "agency_id": 1,
            "agency": {
                "id": 1,
                "name": "Demo Agency"
            },
            "client_id": 1,
            "client": {
                "id": 1,
                "name": "Demo Client"
            },
            "imei": "5551234567890",
            "serial_no": "65G4423",
            "stock_no": null,
            "name": null,
            "unit_type_code": "teltonika",
            "unit_type_name": "Teltonika",
            "unit_model_code": "fmb920",
            "unit_model_name": "FMB920",
            "unit_status_code": null,
            "unit_status_name": null,
            "unit_group_id": null,
            "unit_group": null,
            "ignition": "independent",
            "fixed_latitude": null,
            "fixed_longitude": null,
            "vehicle_id": 1,

            },
            "timezone": "UTC",

    "pagination": {

        "per_page": 30,
        "prev_page_url": null,
        "next_page_url": "https://www.dummydomain.net/api/v1/units?page=2",
        "first_item": 1,
        "last_item": 30
    }
}

request.description:
This request returns details of all the vehicles that are available to you in a paginated format.

> **Important:** The vehicle details returned with this request does not include GPS tracking or other sensor data.

response.name: 200 OK
response.body:

request.description:
Requests a unit/device's last known location and sensor data. 

> **Tip:** Each unit that is returned when you request a list of units have a database id (simply called `id`). Use this id for the `{{unit_id}}` parameter when making the `monitoring/units/{{unit_id}}` request, for example `monitoring/units/1`.

If there are telemetry data available, all of it will be returned within the `telemetry` section of the result, if no telemetry data is available then the `telemetry` section will be `null`.

response.name: 200 OK
response.body:
{
    "data": {
        "telemetry": {
            "gps": {

                ],

request.description:
Requests a vehicle's last known location and sensor data.

> **Important:** Since a vehicle may have more than one GPS device installed you have to specify which device's telemetry data to return. Notice the `/primary/` section after the `vehicle_id`, you can specify `/backup_1/` and `/backup_2/` as alternatives to `/primary/`.

If there are telemetry data available, all of it will be returned within the `telemetry` section of the result, if no telemetry data is available then the `telemetry` section will be `null`.
